meanings.definition: Not consisting of or containing cells.
meanings.sent1: The virus is noncellular and cannot reproduce on its own.
meanings.sent2: The noncellular material was unable to divide and grow like living organisms.
meanings.sent3: The noncellular substance seemed jealous of the busy cells around it.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were like noncellular entities, floating freely without structure.
meanings.sent5: The noncellular structure of the crystal made it unique and fascinating to study.

meanings.definition: Not related to or involving cells.
meanings.sent1: The noncellular research focused on chemical reactions outside of cells.
meanings.sent2: His work in noncellular biology explored the interactions between molecules.
meanings.sent3: The noncellular topic seemed to have a life of its own, separate from biology.
meanings.sent4: Their relationship was like a noncellular connection, based on shared interests beyond cells.
meanings.sent5: The noncellular approach to the problem provided a fresh perspective on the issue.
